page.title: 03HACEBY-A VANISHED VILLAGE.
page.content: According to 1563 records this place had 40 families but in 1985 only 4 people live there:a gamekeeper and a farmworker with their wives.Until 1892 whentheparish was joined tothat of Newton,Haceby had its own Rector and its population was 73.The whole village is estate-owned and has been encouraged to decline as houses have been demolished as soon as tenancies expired.Today there are 3 houses,1 fully-modernised farmyard with grain drier,silos and store-sheds and the old church,now in the care ofthe Historic Churches Trust.This church, with its interior much as it must have been in 1563,has only i service each year.The surrounding fields yield Roman and later artefacts.
